title: EastEnders spoilers: Ben is arrested after Martin sets him up
text:
Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden) has had Martin Fowler (James Bye) taking part in all sorts of dodgy deals over the last few weeks in EastEnders, but it’s safe to say that Martin’s had enough, and — during tonight’s episode — he took drastic action to put a stop to Ben’s blackmail.

After acquiring a car for Ben — to replace the one that the young lad had stolen from Kheerat (Jaz Deol) — Martin came to realise that Ben had filmed him stealing the vehicle so that he could blackmail him into continuing their alliance.

Over the past few weeks, we’ve seen Martin accompanying Tubbs on a series of pick-ups — several of which got out of hand, and Martin was forced to resort to violence as a result.

In tonight’s episode, Ben asked Martin to go with Tubbs on another two-man pick-up job — something which meant he’d have to bail on the plans he’d made with Bex (Jasmine Armfield). As a result, Martin decided he’d had enough of Ben’s demands.

He spilled the beans to Jack (Scott Maslen), and a plan was subsequently set in motion. As a result, Tubbs was arrested, and Martin proceeded to pull out all the stops to ensure Ben accompanied him on the pick-up so that the police could catch him in the act.

The plan was successful, and Ben was arrested on the job — while Martin got out of dodge.

Later, a fuming Ben asked Martin to meet him at home, and proceeded to threaten the fruit-and-veg stall owner over his actions. However, Martin remained unfazed by Ben’s words, and called him nothing more than a coward.

Martin may have the upper hand right now, but it’s clear that Ben’s not going to let him away with what happened.

There’ll no doubt be huge repercussions — but what price will Martin pay for betraying Ben?

EastEnders continues Friday 25thOctober at 8:30pm.
